question: Car A has a mass of 400 kg.
Car B has a mass of 300 kg.
Before the collision:
Car A is moving to the right at a velocity of 20 m/s.
Car B is stationary.
After the collision.
Car A is stationary.
How fast is car B moving?
Car A has a mass of 200 kg.
Car B has a mass of 400 kg.
Before the collision:
Car A is stationary
Car B is moving right with a speed of 10 m/s.
After the collision:
Car B is stationary
How fast is car A moving?
Car A has a mass of 200 kg.
Car B has a mass of 150 kg
Before the collision:
Car A is moving 5 m/s to the right
Car B is moving 7 m/s to the left
After the collision:
Car A is stationary
What is the velocity of car B (magnitude and direction)?
problems.directions: This problem requires extra directions on how to represent motion in different directions.

question: Car A has a mass of 220 kg
Car B has a mass of 180 kg
Before the collision:
Car A is moving 6.0 m/s to the right.
Car B is moving 4.0 m/s to the left.
After the collision
Car A is moving 2.0 m/s to the left.
What is the velocity of car B to (direction and magnitude)?
